St. Mary's enrollment includes students in grades 9-12 from four counties and approximately 30 school districts. The current Principal is Rebecca Kranz. ==Background== St. Mary's High School was established in 1904. ==Curriculum== St. Mary's High School offers a challenging curriculum featuring a variety of Honors and Advanced Placement courses. In the spirit of educating the whole student there are many extracurricular activities including a very successful Athletic program, a high-quality Performing Arts department and a whole list of clubs and organizations catering our students interests. There are, as of the 2009 school year, 333 students. The Freshmen class, composed of 109 students, is the largest in years. ==Athletics== The St. Mary's Athletic Department includes 12 men's teams and 11 women's teams. St. Mary's has won the [[Monsignor Martin Athletic Association]] "A" League Supremacy Cup for the past 8 consecutive years. The current athletic director is Dan Gill, who has been named coach for St. Mary's basketball program. On February 8th in a game against [[Buffalo Seminary]], Raeann Stilwell broke both a school and MMAA (women's) league record for most points scored in a basketball career.http://www.buffalonews.com/sports/high-schools/article336386.ece The St Mary's club lacross team has won the Independent Lacross Championship three years in a row.
